thread.title: Easy way to cut down on your energy costs
thread.title_full: Easy way to cut down on your energy costs

author: Sophie Elsworth
title: Easy way to cut down on your energy costs
text:
PEOPLE power has been turned into power-bill savings — and the spark for an energy price war.
Tens of thousands of NSW residents who joined the fight against rising power costs have succeeded in creating potential savings of more than $600 a year on their utility costs.
The Big Energy Switch — a joint initiative between News Corp Australia and One Big Switch — saw more than 19,000 households sign up to a campaign to help deliver more competitive electricity and gas charges.
Resulting discounts of up to 22 per cent off Energy Australia’s market electricity costs and 16 per cent off their gas usage costs could see NSW households with hundreds of extra dollars in their pocket a year.
This latest offer is available to both existing Energy Australia customers and new consumers who sign up.
One Big Switch spokesman Joel Gibson said the unlocking of the deal — a result of customers joining forces to show they were fed up with rising prices — had delivered consumers a win.
“This is a fantastic result for People Power in NSW and could kick off a new energy price war,’’ he said.
“If consumers make the most of these offers, it could have an impact across the whole market.”
Father-of-three Scott Willis said he and his wife Jacqui, from Castle Hill, joined the campaign because they were fed up with high electricity prices.
“I moved into a five-bedroom home in 2009 and our first electricity bill was $2200 over the summer,’’ he said.
“I’ve bought an electricity monitor now so we can keep an eye on our consumption in the home.”
There is still time to join up to the campaign but there’s no obligation to take up the offer.
One Big Switch, News Corp and Seven West Media will earn a commission from any accepted offers.
To join visit onebigswitch.com .
